mlogic.algos.struct

Class BinaryHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlogic.algos.struct.BinaryHeap<T>

  • public class BinaryHeap<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Binary Heap is a binary tree stored in an array. The items are arranged such that ever k'th item is greater than its two children at positions 2k and 2k+1. Primarily used in the heap sort algorithm.
    Author:
    Rajaram G

      Tests if the input array is arranged as a binary heap
      void setHeapSize(int newSize)
      Sets the size of the heap within the array.

      Recursively sinks the current item deeper into its sub-tree so that the sub-tree rooted at the given index becomes a binary heap.

        Returns:

      • heapify

        public void heapify()
        Iterates through the first half of the array and "sinks" each item into its sub-tree.

      • setHeapSize

        public void setHeapSize(int newSize)
        Sets the size of the heap within the array. Further heap operations will apply only for items within this size.
        Parameters:
        newSize -

      • swap

        public void swap(int u,
                 int v)
        Swaps the items at the specified indices
        Parameters:
        u - - index of the first item
        v - - index of the second item

      • sink

        public void sink(int u)
        Recursively sinks the current item deeper into its sub-tree so that the sub-tree rooted at the given index becomes a binary heap.
        Parameters:
        u - - index of item to be sunk
